Loop 1 (outer boundary): - Curve 1: Line_1 - Start Point: [0.127, 0.0] - End Point: [0.623, 0.0] - Curve 2: Arc_1 - Start Point: [0.623, 0.0] - Mid Point: [0.75, 0.2813] - End Point: [0.623, 0.5625] - Curve 3: Line\\_2 - Start Point: [0.623, 0.5625] - End Point: [0.127, 0.5625] - Curve 4: Arc\\_2 - Start Point: [0.127, 0.5625] - Mid Point: [0.0, 0.2813] - End Point: [0.127, 0.0] Loop 2 (inner circle): - Curve 1: Circle\\_1 - Center: [0.375, 0.2812] - Radius: 0.1991 Face 2: There are no additional curves or loops for face\\_2. After creating the required sketch, proceed to scale it using the sketch\\_scale parameter with a value of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by applying the euler angles and the translation vector from the coordinate\\_system component. Extrude the sketch along the normal by a depth of 0.0938. The opposite direction depth is 0.0, as this operation creates a new solid body. The resulting height of this part is 0.0938 which is less than the width or length (0.75) making it a slightly tapered cylindrical object. Confirm and save the final CAD model for Part 1, adhering to the given specifications and including all of the mentioned curves, loops, and faces.</description>
